thread.title: David Jones goes digital: New ad campaign featuring sports stars, musos breaks all the rules
thread.title_full: David Jones goes digital: New ad campaign featuring sports stars, musos breaks all the rules | DailyTelegraph

author: PRUE LEWINGTON
title: David Jones goes digital: New ad campaign featuring sports stars, musos breaks all the rules
text:
IT’S a side of David Jones we haven’t seen before.
The Australian retail giant will launch an extraordinary digital campaign tomorrow featuring sports heroes, dancers and musicians — and the new look will shock.
The first scenes include former Sydney Swans player Adam Goodes suiting up, along with action shots featuring You Am I frontman Tim Rogers, Sydney Dance Company dancer Juliette Barton, champion youth high jumper Amy Pejkovic, model Tahnee Atkinson, actor Alex Russell and David Jones ambassador, Jessica Gomes.
Model Amy Pejkovic represents “Elation”. Australian Retailers Association executive director Russell Zimmerman said the digital age was moving faster than ever. And to survive, retailers have to rethink their marketing strategy and the ­talent they use: “We have now moved to online and retail is evolving all the time.
“We’re seeing a whole lot of digital advertising that a few years ago would have been done through TV and magazines. New talent in the mix adds diversification and shoppers have affinity with high-profile names.’’
Since South Africa’s Woolworths Holdings’ $2.2 billion takeover of David Jones last year the store has removed 180 brands and had 6.4 per cent increase in sales to $1.9 billion in the six months to June 30.

Jessica Gomes is “Confidence”. Singer Tim Rogers has “Swagger”. Models Amy Pejkovic and Tahnee Atkinson. Picture: Dylan Robinson
